statement.text: While direct probes of the Planck scale require energies 10¹⁵× higher than LHC, several indirect experimental approaches can constrain Planck-scale physics. This includes gamma-ray dispersion from distant astrophysical sources, precision measurements of Lorentz invariance, gravitational wave observations, and tabletop quantum experiments. These provide limits on GUP parameters and minimum length predictions.
statement.key_insight: Indirect tests can probe Planck-scale effects through precision and long baselines

experimental_approaches.name: Gamma-ray dispersion (Fermi satellite)
experimental_approaches.principle: If minimum length exists, photons of different energies might travel at slightly different speeds
experimental_approaches.formula: v(E) = c·[1 - ξ(E/E_P)ⁿ] where n=1 or 2
experimental_approaches.observable: Time delay between high and low energy photons from distant GRBs
experimental_approaches.current_limits: No dispersion observed to E ~ 10¹⁹ eV for sources at z ~ 1
experimental_approaches.implication: Rules out linear (n=1) Lorentz violation at Planck scale; quadratic (n=2) still allowed

experimental_approaches.name: Gravitational wave tests
experimental_approaches.principle: Gravitons might also have energy-dependent speeds or GW memory effects
experimental_approaches.observable: Phase evolution of compact binary coalescences
experimental_approaches.current_limits: GW170104: speed of gravity = c to 10⁻¹⁵ precision
experimental_approaches.implication: Constrains some Lorentz-violating quantum gravity models
experimental_approaches.future: LISA could probe lower frequencies, potentially more sensitive

experimental_approaches.name: Tabletop GUP tests
experimental_approaches.principle: GUP modifies position-momentum commutator, affecting oscillator frequencies
experimental_approaches.observable: Shifted energy levels in precision oscillators
experimental_approaches.future: Improving rapidly with optomechanics and atom interferometry

experimental_approaches.name: CMB polarization
experimental_approaches.principle: Loop quantum cosmology predicts specific patterns in primordial fluctuations
experimental_approaches.observable: B-mode polarization patterns, specific features in power spectrum
experimental_approaches.current_limits: No definitive LQC signatures found yet
experimental_approaches.future: Future CMB experiments (CMB-S4) could be more sensitive

experimental_approaches.name: Decoherence experiments
experimental_approaches.principle: Spacetime foam might cause decoherence in quantum superpositions
experimental_approaches.observable: Loss of coherence in matter-wave interferometry
experimental_approaches.current_limits: Large molecules maintain coherence over long times

why_these_work.long_baseline: Gamma rays travel billions of light-years; tiny effects accumulate
why_these_work.precision: Atomic clocks measure to 10⁻¹⁸ relative precision
why_these_work.key_insight: Planck effects at 10⁻³⁵ m might manifest at macroscopic scales through accumulation

current_status.confirmed: NONE - no Planck-scale effects detected yet
current_status.challenge: Effects suppressed by (E/E_P)² ~ 10⁻³⁰ at LHC - incredibly small!

definition.@value: An overview of experimental methods for indirectly testing Planck-scale physics through precision measurements and long-baseline observations

learning_objectives: Describe indirect experimental approaches to Planck-scale physics
Understand why long baselines and precision compensate for low energy
Recognize current experimental limits on quantum gravity
Appreciate what has been ruled out vs. what remains testable
physics_insights: Fermi satellite rules out linear photon dispersion to Planck scale
GUP parameter β < 10²¹ from tabletop experiments
Indirect tests work: 10⁹ ly baseline × 10⁻³⁵ m effect = measurable!
